stratagems.legend: Point-defence systems trigger as incoming fire is detected, blasting projectiles from the air and lessening the power of the enemy fusillade.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

stratagems.name: THE ARRO’KON PROTOCOL
stratagems.legend: Commander Arro’kon’s teachings are considered pre-eminent in the art of engaging and eliminating numerically overwhelming enemy formations.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit that contains 6 or more models, that attack has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. If that attack targets an enemy unit that contains 11 or more models, it has the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit that contains 6 or more models, that attack has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. If that attack targets an enemy unit that contains 11 or more models, it has the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead.

stratagems.name: FAIL-SAFE DETONATOR
stratagems.legend: Devices are incorporated into some battlesuits either to prevent high-ranking pilots being taken alive for interrogation or to prevent just such fatal explosions.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Any phase, just after a T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model from your army is destroyed.TARGET: That destroyed model’s unit. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even if that unit was just destroyed.EFFECT: Before removing your model from play, if it has the Deadly Demise ability, do not roll for that ability; instead, you can choose whether the result of that roll is a 1 or a 6. If your model does not have the Deadly Demise ability, roll one D6 for each unit within 6" of it: on a 4+, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after a T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model from your army is destroyed.
stratagems.target: That destroyed model’s unit. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even if that unit was just destroyed.
stratagems.effect: Before removing your model from play, if it has the Deadly Demise ability, do not roll for that ability; instead, you can choose whether the result of that roll is a 1 or a 6. If your model does not have the Deadly Demise ability, roll one D6 for each unit within 6" of it: on a 4+, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

stratagems.name: GRAV-INHIBITOR FIELD
stratagems.legend: First used by O’Jir during the battle for Laguna Shard, these battlesuit-mounted emitters batter advancing foes backwards with gravitic pulse waves.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.EFFECT: That enemy unit must immediately take a Battle-shock test and you must roll one D6 for each model in that enemy unit: for each 6, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.
stratagems.effect: That enemy unit must immediately take a Battle-shock test and you must roll one D6 for each model in that enemy unit: for each 6, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

stratagems.name: THE TORCHSTAR GAMBIT
stratagems.legend: Though now disgraced by association with O'Shovah, Sub-Commander Torchstar’s strike-and-fade tactics are still taught - albeit officially under other names - in many Fire caste academies.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that can FLY whose attacks have been resolved this phase.EFFECT: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move. If it does, your unit cannot declare a charge this turn
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that can FLY whose attacks have been resolved this phase.
stratagems.effect: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move. If it does, your unit cannot declare a charge this turn

stratagems.name: THE SHORTENED BLADE
stratagems.legend: Made famous by Commander Farsight and his protege Brightsword, this philosophy encourages pilots to drop into the very teeth of the enemy army and apply their firepower at point-blank range.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Movement phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.EFFECT: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models.RESTRICTIONS: A unit targeted with this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models.RESTRICTIONS: A unit targeted with this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

stratagems.name: STIMM INJECTORS
stratagems.legend: On-board hypodermics shunt pain-blockers and chemical stimulants into the pilot's system.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.

stratagems.name: RESPONSIVE VOLLEY
stratagems.legend: Should enemy forces be suddenly revealed during such close-confines combat, Fire caste soldiery are trained to loose immediate, punishing firepower.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army opens a Hatchway.TARGET: That FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit.EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit wholly on the opposite side of that Hatchway from them, a Critical Hit is scored on an unmodified Hit roll of 5+, instead of only a 6.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after a FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army opens a Hatchway.
stratagems.target: That FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit wholly on the opposite side of that Hatchway from them, a Critical Hit is scored on an unmodified Hit roll of 5+, instead of only a 6.

stratagems.name: PULSE BARRAGE
stratagems.legend: The tight confines of voidship warfare funnel the enemy right into the waiting T'au guns.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your opponent’s Movement or Charge phase.TARGET: One FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army that has not fired Overwatch this phase.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack while firing Overwatch, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ is required to score a hit, instead of an unmodified 6.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement or Charge phase.
stratagems.target: One FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army that has not fired Overwatch this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack while firing Overwatch, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ is required to score a hit, instead of an unmodified 6.

stratagems.name: RETREATING FIRE
stratagems.legend: Collapsing lines of infantry provide a defence in depth through the shipboard confines, allowing the enemy to overextend even as retreating T'au continue to pour fire into them.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.
stratagems.target: One FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.

stratagems.name: FIRING LINE
stratagems.legend: Should the foe break through one line of Fire caste defence, the next is ready to push them back from vital sites aboard the contested ship.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit destroys a T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army.TARGET: One FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, has not fired Overwatch this turn and is within 9" of that enemy unit.EFFECT: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but when doing so, models in your unit can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target) and, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ is required to score a hit.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit destroys a T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army.
stratagems.target: One FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, has not fired Overwatch this turn and is within 9" of that enemy unit.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but when doing so, models in your unit can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target) and, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ is required to score a hit.

stratagems.name: GUIDED FIRE
stratagems.legend: These Fire Warriors employ sensory data fed to them by supporting alien auxiliary units to maximise accuracy and place their shots against weak points they might not have perceived.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army (excluding KROOT and VESPID STINGWINGS units) that has not been selected to shoot this phase.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit. If your unit is wholly within 9" of one or more KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS units from your army, add 2 to the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit instead.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army (excluding KROOT and VESPID STINGWINGS units) that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit. If your unit is wholly within 9" of one or more KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS units from your army, add 2 to the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit instead.

stratagems.name: ALIEN EXPERTISE
stratagems.legend: There is much that the alien auxiliaries of the T’au empire can teach the Fire caste, not least through practical and deadly battlefield demonstrations.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Movement phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army.EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced. If it is a KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit, until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced as well.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced. If it is a KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit, until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced as well.

stratagems.name: MULTISENSORY SCANNING
stratagems.legend: Target analysis data from scanning drones is rapidly translated into inputs ideally tailored to a range of alien sensoria and then disseminated through the cadre.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1. If it is a KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll instead.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1. If it is a KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll instead.

stratagems.name: INTERLOCKING MANOUEVRES
stratagems.legend: Regular Fire caste forces operating as part of auxiliary cadres are well trained in swift repositioning and fighting retreats, the better to exploit the presence of or provide support for their alien comrades.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: End of the Fight phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that was eligible to fight this phase.EFFECT: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to 6". Otherwise, your unit can make a Fall Back move. It cannot embark within a TRANSPORT at the end of this move if it disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that was eligible to fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to 6". Otherwise, your unit can make a Fall Back move. It cannot embark within a TRANSPORT at the end of this move if it disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn.

stratagems.name: PHEROMONE WAYPOINTS
stratagems.legend: Air caste craft have dropped drones that emit pheromones into this region, their emissions invisible but blazing like beacons to the correct alien senses.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Movement phase.TARGET: One KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.
stratagems.target: One KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

stratagems.name: EXPERIMENTAL MODIFICATIONS
stratagems.legend: These experimental Earth caste weapon upgrades can only activate for short bursts at a time, but the extra stopping power they provide is formidable.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.TARGET: One KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.target: One KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.

abilities.name: Integrated Command Structure
abilities.legend: T’au officers given charge of auxiliary cadres receive additional training in optimised doctrinal and strategic alien amalgamation; this – coupled with specialised translation drones and endless integrated combat drills – allows them to get the best out of their alien subordinates.
abilities.rawDescription: KROOT and VESPID STINGWINGS units from your army have the following ability:Targeting Triangulation (Aura): While an enemy unit is within 9" of and visible to this unit, each time a ranged attack made by a friendly T’AU EMPIRE model (excluding KROOT, VESPID STINGWINGS and TITANIC models) targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.T’AU EMPIRE units (excluding KROOT and VESPID STINGWINGS units) from your army have the following ability:Localised Stealth Projectors (Aura): While a friendly KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit is wholly within 6" of and visible to this unit, that KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".
abilities.formattedDescription: KROOT and VESPID STINGWINGS units from your army have the following ability:Targeting Triangulation (Aura): While an enemy unit is within 9" of and visible to this unit, each time a ranged attack made by a friendly T’AU EMPIRE model (excluding KROOT, VESPID STINGWINGS and TITANIC models) targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.T’AU EMPIRE units (excluding KROOT and VESPID STINGWINGS units) from your army have the following ability:Localised Stealth Projectors (Aura): While a friendly KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit is wholly within 6" of and visible to this unit, that KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

enhancements.name: Student of Kauyon
enhancements.legend: This Shaper has not only studied the Code of Fire but has also adapted it to best suit their people’s skills.
enhancements.rawDescription: KROOT SHAPER model only. In the Declare Battle Formations step, you can select up to three KROOT CARNIVORES or KROOT FARSTALKERS units from your army. Models in those units have the Deep Strike ability.
enhancements.formattedDescription: KROOT SHAPER model only. In the Declare Battle Formations step, you can select up to three KROOT CARNIVORES or KROOT FARSTALKERS units from your army. Models in those units have the Deep Strike ability.

enhancements.name: Admired Leader
enhancements.legend: Having proven themselves to their alien charges, this T’au has won their fierce loyalty and become an iconic folk hero to them.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model (excluding KROOT models) only. In your Command phase, you can select one KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit within 12" of the bearer. If you do, until the start of your next Command phase, improve the Leadership characteristic of models in that unit by 1, and while such a unit is not Battle-shocked, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in that unit.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model (excluding KROOT models) only. In your Command phase, you can select one KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit within 12" of the bearer. If you do, until the start of your next Command phase, improve the Leadership characteristic of models in that unit by 1, and while such a unit is not Battle-shocked, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in that unit.

enhancements.name: Fanatical Convert
enhancements.legend: This true believer strives to embody the T’au’va even more entirely than the T’au themselves.
enhancements.rawDescription: KROOT model only. The bearer’s unit has the For the Greater Good ability.
enhancements.formattedDescription: KROOT model only. The bearer’s unit has the For the Greater Good ability.

enhancements.name: Transponder Lock Module
enhancements.legend: This system detects transponders borne deep into the field by alien auxiliaries and guides its user unerringly in on their positions.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE WALKER model with the Deep Strike ability only. The bearer’s unit can be set up using the Deep Strike ability in the Reinforcements step of your first, second or third Movement phase, regardless of any mission rules. During your first Movement phase, when you set up the bearer’s unit, it must be set up within 12" of one or more friendly KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS units and not within 9" horizontally of one or more enemy units.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE WALKER model with the Deep Strike ability only. The bearer’s unit can be set up using the Deep Strike ability in the Reinforcements step of your first, second or third Movement phase, regardless of any mission rules. During your first Movement phase, when you set up the bearer’s unit, it must be set up within 12" of one or more friendly KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS units and not within 9" horizontally of one or more enemy units.

stratagems.name: A TEMPTING TRAP
stratagems.legend: Kauyon teaches that many things can be used to bait a trap, luring the foe into position.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase. The first time you use this Stratagem, you must also select one objective marker that is not in your opponent’s deployment zone; until the end of the battle, this becomes your Trap objective marker.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit within range of your Trap objective marker, add 1 to the Wound roll.RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem during the first or second battle rounds.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase. The first time you use this Stratagem, you must also select one objective marker that is not in your opponent’s deployment zone; until the end of the battle, this becomes your Trap objective marker.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit within range of your Trap objective marker, add 1 to the Wound roll.RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem during the first or second battle rounds.

stratagems.name: WALL OF MIRRORS
stratagems.legend: T’au Stealth Cadres utilise obfuscation fields and wide-band refraction beams to mask their advance.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.TARGET: One STEALTH, GHOSTKEEL or COMMANDER SHADOWSUN unit from your army.EFFECT: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.RESTRICTIONS: You cannot target a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.target: One STEALTH, GHOSTKEEL or COMMANDER SHADOWSUN unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.RESTRICTIONS: You cannot target a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

stratagems.name: COORDINATE TO ENGAGE
stratagems.legend: T’au Hunter Cadres work in close coordination to destroy the most dangerous enemy targets.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has just been selected as an Observer unit (see For the Greater Good).EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets their Spotted unit, improve the Ballistic Skill characteristic of that attack by 1 and, if your unit has the MARKERLIGHT keyword, that attack has the [IGNORES COVER] ability.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has just been selected as an Observer unit (see For the Greater Good).
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets their Spotted unit, improve the Ballistic Skill characteristic of that attack by 1 and, if your unit has the MARKERLIGHT keyword, that attack has the [IGNORES COVER] ability.

stratagems.name: POINT-BLANK AMBUSH
stratagems.legend: Devastating firepower need not be applied from afar, especially when striking an unsuspecting foe.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit within 9", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem during the first or second battle rounds.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit within 9", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem during the first or second battle rounds.

stratagems.name: PHOTON GRENADES
stratagems.legend: Hurling a volley of photon grenades, the T’au leave their enemies dazzled and disorientated, unable to close the distance into combat at a crucial moment.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE GRENADES unit from your army that was selected as one of the targets of that charge.EFFECT: That enemy unit must immediately take a Battle-shock test, and until the end of the phase, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE GRENADES unit from your army that was selected as one of the targets of that charge.
stratagems.effect: That enemy unit must immediately take a Battle-shock test, and until the end of the phase, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit.

stratagems.name: COMBAT EMBARKATION
stratagems.legend: Those who act as the lure in the Kauyon must be ready to make a hasty withdrawal once the enemy closes into killing range, lest they be trapped.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as one of the targets of that charge, and one friendly TRANSPORT.EFFECT: Your unit can embark within that TRANSPORT. If it does, your opponent can select new targets for that charge.RESTRICTIONS: Every model in your T’AU EMPIRE INFANTRY unit must be within 3" of that TRANSPORT and there must be sufficient transport capacity to embark the entire unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as one of the targets of that charge, and one friendly TRANSPORT.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can embark within that TRANSPORT. If it does, your opponent can select new targets for that charge.RESTRICTIONS: Every model in your T’AU EMPIRE INFANTRY unit must be within 3" of that TRANSPORT and there must be sufficient transport capacity to embark the entire unit.

abilities.name: Patient Hunter
abilities.legend: The tactical philosophy known as the Kauyon allows for T’au commanders to draw the enemy into a deadly trap, springing it at the perfect moment to deliver a storm of fatal strikes against which none can escape.
abilities.rawDescription: From the third battle round onwards, all ranged weapons equipped by T’AU EMPIRE models from your army have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability, or the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead while targeting their unit’s Spotted unit.
abilities.formattedDescription: From the third battle round onwards, all ranged weapons equipped by T’AU EMPIRE models from your army have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability, or the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead while targeting their unit’s Spotted unit.

enhancements.name: Exemplar of the Kauyon
enhancements.legend: Long meditation upon the tenets of the Patient Hunter has seen this warrior master the application of this cunning ambush strategy. When they take to the battlefield, they embody the teachings of the Kauyon, much to the dismay of their luckless prey.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only (excluding KROOT SHAPER models). While the bearer is leading a unit, the Patient Hunter Detachment rule applies to that unit from the second battle round onwards instead of from the third.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only (excluding KROOT SHAPER models). While the bearer is leading a unit, the Patient Hunter Detachment rule applies to that unit from the second battle round onwards instead of from the third.

enhancements.name: Precision of the Patient Hunter
enhancements.legend: This warrior prowls the battlefield like a high-tech predator, stalking and assessing their quarry before they strike. When they do launch their assault, their every shot and blow is informed by careful observations, perfectly aimed where they will do the greatest harm.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only. Each time the bearer makes a ranged attack, add 1 to the Hit roll. From the third battle round onwards, add 1 to the Wound roll as well.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only. Each time the bearer makes a ranged attack, add 1 to the Hit roll. From the third battle round onwards, add 1 to the Wound roll as well.

enhancements.name: Solid-image Projection Unit
enhancements.legend: This holowave-emitter drone projects beams of so-called heavy light, forming convincing illusory images while simultaneously masking the true locations of its allies with advanced refraction fields.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only. After both players have deployed their armies, select up to three T’AU EMPIRE units from your army and redeploy them. When doing so, you can set those units up in Strategic Reserves if you wish, regardless of how many units are already in Strategic Reserves.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only. After both players have deployed their armies, select up to three T’AU EMPIRE units from your army and redeploy them. When doing so, you can set those units up in Strategic Reserves if you wish, regardless of how many units are already in Strategic Reserves.

enhancements.name: Through Unity, Devastation
enhancements.legend: Under their calm tutelage of this leader, warriors of the Fire caste maximise every shot they fire, creating a blizzard of deadly energy.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only (excluding KROOT SHAPER models). While this model is leading a unit, each time that unit is an Observer unit, until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in their Guided unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability while targeting their Spotted unit.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only (excluding KROOT SHAPER models). While this model is leading a unit, each time that unit is an Observer unit, until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in their Guided unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability while targeting their Spotted unit.

stratagems.name: A TRAP WELL LAID
stratagems.type: Kroot Hunting Pack – Battle Tactic Stratagem
stratagems.legend: The Kroot have long perfected the art of ambush hunting, their packs working in deadly concert.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.TARGET: One KROOT unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.EFFECT: After your unit has resolved its attacks this phase, select one enemy unit that was hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the phase, each time a KROOT model from your army makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, unless the attacking unit is Battle-shocked, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.target: One KROOT unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: After your unit has resolved its attacks this phase, select one enemy unit that was hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the phase, each time a KROOT model from your army makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, unless the attacking unit is Battle-shocked, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

stratagems.name: JOIN THE HUNT
stratagems.type: Kroot Hunting Pack – Battle Tactic Stratagem
stratagems.legend: When a Kroot Hunting Pack closes in on its prey, there are often other hunters waiting to join in the fray and take their share of any spoils.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Any phase.TARGET: One KROOT INFANTRY or KROOT HOUNDS unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.EFFECT: Add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Strategic Reserves, at its Starting Strength.RESTRICTIONS: This Stratagem cannot be used to return destroyed CHARACTER units to Attached units. You can only use this Stratagem once per battle.
stratagems.target: One KROOT INFANTRY or KROOT HOUNDS unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.effect: Add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Strategic Reserves, at its Starting Strength.RESTRICTIONS: This Stratagem cannot be used to return destroyed CHARACTER units to Attached units. You can only use this Stratagem once per battle.

stratagems.name: THE GRISLY FEAST
stratagems.type: Kroot Hunting Pack – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: The psychological impact of witnessing one's comrades being dismembered and devoured by gore-splattered Kroot cannot be overstated.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Fight phase.TARGET: One KROOT unit from your army that destroyed one or more enemy units this phase.EFFECT: In your opponent’s next Command phase, each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle-shock test. If the unit taking that test is Below Half-strength, subtract 1 from that test. Enemy units affected by this Stratagem do not need to take any other Battle-shock tests in the same phase.
stratagems.target: One KROOT unit from your army that destroyed one or more enemy units this phase.
stratagems.effect: In your opponent’s next Command phase, each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle-shock test. If the unit taking that test is Below Half-strength, subtract 1 from that test. Enemy units affected by this Stratagem do not need to take any other Battle-shock tests in the same phase.

stratagems.name: HIDDEN HUNTERS
stratagems.type: Kroot Hunting Pack – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: The Kroot are experts in camouflage and concealment, able to utilise cover in ways most foes would never consider and - to their great misfortune - do not anticipate.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.TARGET: One KROOT unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One KROOT unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

stratagems.name: GUERRILLA WARRIORS
stratagems.type: Kroot Hunting Pack – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Kroot see no value in stand-up fights, caring little for honour or glory. They hit and fade, frustrating their foes and bleeding them by degrees until - weakened and out of position - they are rendered vulnerable.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a KROOT unit from your army Falls Back.TARGET: That KROOT unit.EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after a KROOT unit from your army Falls Back.
stratagems.target: That KROOT unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge.

stratagems.name: EMP GRENADES
stratagems.legend: Furnished by T’au allies or returning Farstalkers, these electromagnetic grenades wreak havoc with the animuses of armoured fighting vehicles.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy VEHICLE unit is selected to shoot or fight.TARGET: One KROOT GRENADES unit from your army within 8" of that enemy VEHICLE unit.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, worsen the Weapon Skill and Ballistic Skill characteristics of that enemy VEHICLE unit’s weapons by 1.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy VEHICLE unit is selected to shoot or fight.
stratagems.target: One KROOT GRENADES unit from your army within 8" of that enemy VEHICLE unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, worsen the Weapon Skill and Ballistic Skill characteristics of that enemy VEHICLE unit’s weapons by 1.

abilities.name: Hunter’s Instincts
abilities.legend: The Kroot naturally predate upon weakened foes, drawn by the scent of spilled blood and viscera.
abilities.rawDescription: Each time a KROOT model from your army makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll if the target of that attack is below its Starting Strength, and add 1 to the Wound roll as well if the target of that attack is Below Half-strength.
abilities.formattedDescription: Each time a KROOT model from your army makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll if the target of that attack is below its Starting Strength, and add 1 to the Wound roll as well if the target of that attack is Below Half-strength.

abilities.name: Skirmish Fighters
abilities.legend: Though ill-suited to protracted warfare, the Kroot are experts at light, swift skirmishing. Here their fieldcraft and wiry natural agility help them to evade the hostile attentions of their foes.
abilities.rawDescription: KROOT models from your army have a 6+ invulnerable save against melee attacks and a 5+ invulnerable save against ranged attacks.
abilities.formattedDescription: KROOT models from your army have a 6+ invulnerable save against melee attacks and a 5+ invulnerable save against ranged attacks.

abilities.name: KEYWORDS
abilities.rawDescription: If you select this Detachment, KROOT CARNIVORE units from your army have the Battleline keyword.
abilities.formattedDescription: If you select this Detachment, KROOT CARNIVORE units from your army have the Battleline keyword.

enhancements.name: Borthrod Gland
enhancements.legend: The Kroot found the flesh of the Borthrod so irresistible they hunted them to extinction. This preserved gland still exudes pheromones that drive nearby Kroot into a ravenous frenzy.
enhancements.rawDescription: Kroot Flesh Shaper only. While the bearer is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.
enhancements.formattedDescription: Kroot Flesh Shaper only. While the bearer is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

enhancements.name: Kroothawk Flock
enhancements.legend: This leader has painstakingly established a deep-seated bond with a small flock of Kroothawks. The avian creatures circle on high, spying out and revealing the hiding places of the prey or warning of ambushing enemies with wing-dips, diving stoops and harsh shrieks.
enhancements.rawDescription: KROOT model only. Ranged weapons equipped by models in the bearer’s unit have the [IGNORES COVER] ability, and enemy units that are set up on the battlefield as Reinforcements cannot be set up within 12" horizontally of the bearer.
enhancements.formattedDescription: KROOT model only. Ranged weapons equipped by models in the bearer’s unit have the [IGNORES COVER] ability, and enemy units that are set up on the battlefield as Reinforcements cannot be set up within 12" horizontally of the bearer.

enhancements.name: Nomadic Hunter
enhancements.legend: This Shaper’s followers have become adept at the loping pursuit, snapping off harassing fire as they tirelessly and mercilessly run their victims to ground.
enhancements.rawDescription: KROOT TRAIL SHAPER model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, add 3" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit and ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [ASSAULT] ability.
enhancements.formattedDescription: KROOT TRAIL SHAPER model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, add 3" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit and ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [ASSAULT] ability.

enhancements.name: Root-carved Weapons
enhancements.legend: Just as the Kroot venerate the so-called Roots from which their culture derives, so they prize the traditional forms of Root-carved weapons and must perform exceptional deeds to be permitted to wield them in war.
enhancements.rawDescription: Kroot War Shaper model only. All weapons equipped by the bearer have the [PRECISION] and [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] abilities.
enhancements.formattedDescription: Kroot War Shaper model only. All weapons equipped by the bearer have the [PRECISION] and [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] abilities.

stratagems.name: BOARDING BLADES
stratagems.type: Kroot Raiding Party – Battle Tactic Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Expecting close-quarters carnage, these Kroot have adapted the blades on their weapons to slice through even thick armour.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Fight phase.TARGET: One KROOT unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1. In addition, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, on a Critical Wound, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by an additional 1.
stratagems.target: One KROOT unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1. In addition, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, on a Critical Wound, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by an additional 1.

stratagems.name: SWEEPING AMBUSH
stratagems.type: Kroot Raiding Party – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Once they spring their ambush these Kroot move fast, hacking through one band of foes and pouncing on the next before the enemy can regain their footing.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Fight phase.TARGET: One KROOT unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile-in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3". In addition, when making a Consolidation move, that model can end that move within Engagement Range of the closest enemy unit that was not visible to its unit when it started that move.
stratagems.target: One KROOT unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile-in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3". In addition, when making a Consolidation move, that model can end that move within Engagement Range of the closest enemy unit that was not visible to its unit when it started that move.

stratagems.name: BRUTE FORCE
stratagems.type: Kroot Raiding Party – Strategic Ploy Stratagem
stratagems.legend: Where cunning will not suffice, the brutal strength of Krootox sees hatchways and bulkheads smashed to pieces, filling the corridors beyond with whickering shrapnel.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a KROOTOX RIDERS unit from your army opens a Hatchway.TARGET: That KROOTOX RIDERS unit.EFFECT: Roll one D6 for each unit that is within 3" of that Hatchway, if that Hatchway is visible to that unit and that unit is wholly on the opposite side of it from your unit: on a 2-4, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound; on a 5+, that enemy unit suffers 2 mortal wounds.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after a KROOTOX RIDERS unit from your army opens a Hatchway.
stratagems.target: That KROOTOX RIDERS unit.
stratagems.effect: Roll one D6 for each unit that is within 3" of that Hatchway, if that Hatchway is visible to that unit and that unit is wholly on the opposite side of it from your unit: on a 2-4, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound; on a 5+, that enemy unit suffers 2 mortal wounds.

stratagems.name: TANGLEBOMB BOLAS
stratagems.legend: Sent spinning in to entangle their targets, these weapons leave their victims easy prey for the screeching Kroot.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One KROOT unit from your army.EFFECT: Select one enemy unit within 9" of and visible to your unit and roll one D6: on a 2+, until the start of your next Shooting phase, halve the Move characteristic of models in that enemy unit and halve Advance and Charge rolls made for it.
stratagems.target: One KROOT unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit within 9" of and visible to your unit and roll one D6: on a 2+, until the start of your next Shooting phase, halve the Move characteristic of models in that enemy unit and halve Advance and Charge rolls made for it.

abilities.name: Guerrilla Ambushers
abilities.legend: So stealthy and swift are Kroot on the hunt they are often able to pounce upon their victims before the foe is even aware of their peril.
abilities.rawDescription: Each time an enemy unit is selected to fire Overwatch, roll one D6: on a 4+, until the end of the turn, that unit cannot make Overwatch attacks that target KROOT units from your army.
abilities.formattedDescription: Each time an enemy unit is selected to fire Overwatch, roll one D6: on a 4+, until the end of the turn, that unit cannot make Overwatch attacks that target KROOT units from your army.

enhancements.name: Experienced Leader
enhancements.legend: This Shaper has defeated - and quite possibly devoured - such foes before. They are well able to advise their warriors on how to fight them.
enhancements.rawDescription: At the start of the first battle round, select one enemy unit on the battlefield. Until the end of the battle, each time a KROOT model from your army makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, if the bearer is on the battlefield, you can re-roll the Wound roll.
enhancements.formattedDescription: At the start of the first battle round, select one enemy unit on the battlefield. Until the end of the battle, each time a KROOT model from your army makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, if the bearer is on the battlefield, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

enhancements.name: Quill Marker
enhancements.legend: Subtly adapted through careful shaping, this warrior can use their pheromone dart-quills to mark prey that their raiding party then descend upon with predatory fury.
enhancements.rawDescription: At the start of your Charge phase, select one enemy unit within 12" of the bearer. Until the end of the phase, each time a KROOT unit from your army declares a charge, if it is within 6" of that enemy unit, it can include that enemy unit as a target of that charge, even if it is not visible to it.
enhancements.formattedDescription: At the start of your Charge phase, select one enemy unit within 12" of the bearer. Until the end of the phase, each time a KROOT unit from your army declares a charge, if it is within 6" of that enemy unit, it can include that enemy unit as a target of that charge, even if it is not visible to it.

stratagems.name: PINPOINT COUNTER-OFFENSIVE
stratagems.legend: Mont’ka emphasises rapid evolving threat-analysis and the application of overwhelming firepower to eliminate emergent high-priority targets.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Any phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE unit (excluding KROOT units) from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.EFFECT: Until the end of the battle, each time a T’AU EMPIRE unit (excluding KROOT units) from your army makes an attack that targets the enemy unit that just destroyed your unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit (excluding KROOT units) from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the battle, each time a T’AU EMPIRE unit (excluding KROOT units) from your army makes an attack that targets the enemy unit that just destroyed your unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

stratagems.name: AGGRESSIVE MOBILITY
stratagems.legend: By advancing swiftly into commanding positions, Mont’ka forces maximise the benefits of their enemies' shock and disorientation.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Movement phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

stratagems.name: COMBAT DEBARKATION
stratagems.legend: The most aggressive Fire caste warriors sometimes spring from moving transports, roll with the impact of landing, and come up with weapons already blazing.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE INFANTRY unit from your army that disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets the closest enemy unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE INFANTRY unit from your army that disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets the closest enemy unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

stratagems.name: FOCUSED FIRE
stratagems.legend: Mont’ka doctrine heavily emphasises the massed concentration of fire upon a single target at a time, obliterating each component of the enemy force in succession with a series of unrelenting barrages.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Start of your Shooting phase.TARGET: Two T’AU EMPIRE units from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase, and one enemy unit.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in either of your units makes an attack, it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target for that attack), and when resolving that attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic by 1.RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem during the fourth or fifth battle rounds.
stratagems.target: Two T’AU EMPIRE units from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase, and one enemy unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in either of your units makes an attack, it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target for that attack), and when resolving that attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic by 1.RESTRICTIONS: You cannot use this Stratagem during the fourth or fifth battle rounds.

stratagems.name: PULSE ONSLAUGHT
stratagems.legend: Rather than charge into hand-to-hand combat, T’au soldiery instead intensify their fire patterns, pinning their advancing foes and staving off their onslaught.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE INFANTRY unit (excluding KROOT units) from your army that has just shot, and one enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) hit by one or more of those attacks.EFFECT: Until the end of your opponent’s next turn, that enemy unit is shaken. While a unit is shaken, subtract 2 from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Advance and Charge rolls made for it.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE INFANTRY unit (excluding KROOT units) from your army that has just shot, and one enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) hit by one or more of those attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of your opponent’s next turn, that enemy unit is shaken. While a unit is shaken, subtract 2 from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Advance and Charge rolls made for it.

stratagems.name: COUNTERFIRE DEFENCE SYSTEMS
stratagems.legend: Point-defence systems trigger as incoming fire is detected, blasting projectiles from the air and lessening the power of the enemy fusillade.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

abilities.name: Killing Blow
abilities.legend: Mont’ka is the most aggressive style of T’au warfare. Its singular focus is the art of identifying a target of opportunity and attacking it swiftly with an overwhelming application of force.
abilities.rawDescription: During the first, second and third battle rounds, ranged weapons equipped by T’AU EMPIRE models from your army have the [ASSAULT] ability. During the first, second and third battle rounds, while a unit is a Guided unit, its ranged weapons have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
abilities.formattedDescription: During the first, second and third battle rounds, ranged weapons equipped by T’AU EMPIRE models from your army have the [ASSAULT] ability. During the first, second and third battle rounds, while a unit is a Guided unit, its ranged weapons have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

enhancements.name: Coordinated Exploitation
enhancements.legend: This leader eschews their own martial glory in favour of seeking out an advanced vantage point then exploiting it to guide in the firepower of their fellows.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only (excluding KROOT SHAPER models). While the bearer is leading a unit, each time that unit is an Observer unit, until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in their Guided unit have the [sustained hits 1] ability while targeting their Spotted unit.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only (excluding KROOT SHAPER models). While the bearer is leading a unit, each time that unit is an Observer unit, until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in their Guided unit have the [sustained hits 1] ability while targeting their Spotted unit.

enhancements.name: Exemplar of the Mont’ka
enhancements.legend: This warrior has perfected the art of the Killing Blow, formulating swift and decisive battle plans and leading their cadres from the front in aggressive strikes.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only (excluding KROOT SHAPER models). While the bearer is leading a unit, the Killing Blow Detachment rule applies to that unit during the fourth battle round as well.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only (excluding KROOT SHAPER models). While the bearer is leading a unit, the Killing Blow Detachment rule applies to that unit during the fourth battle round as well.

enhancements.name: Strategic Conqueror
enhancements.legend: A wise commander appreciates the strategic value of seizing a vital battlefield asset swiftly to establish a foothold, employing it as a jumping off point for further assaults or a rallying post for a swift retreat.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only. At the start of the first battle round, before the first turn begins, select one objective marker on the battlefield. While a friendly T’AU EMPIRE model is within range of that objective marker and the bearer is on the battlefield, add 1 to that friendly model’s Objective Control characteristic.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only. At the start of the first battle round, before the first turn begins, select one objective marker on the battlefield. While a friendly T’AU EMPIRE model is within range of that objective marker and the bearer is on the battlefield, add 1 to that friendly model’s Objective Control characteristic.

enhancements.name: Strike Swiftly
enhancements.legend: This commander knows victory is best assured by taking the fight to the enemy as soon as battle is joined.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only. At the start of the battle, before any moves are made using the Scouts ability, you can select up to two friendly T’AU EMPIRE units within 6" of the bearer that do not have the Scouts ability. Until the end of the battle, all models in the selected units have the Scouts 6" ability.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE model only. At the start of the battle, before any moves are made using the Scouts ability, you can select up to two friendly T’AU EMPIRE units within 6" of the bearer that do not have the Scouts ability. Until the end of the battle, all models in the selected units have the Scouts 6" ability.

stratagems.name: THE ARRO’KON PROTOCOL
stratagems.legend: Commander Arro’kon’s teachings are considered pre-eminent in the art of engaging and eliminating numerically overwhelming enemy formations.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit that contains 6 or more models, that attack has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. If that attack targets an enemy unit that contains 11 or more models, it has the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit that contains 6 or more models, that attack has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. If that attack targets an enemy unit that contains 11 or more models, it has the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead.

stratagems.name: FAIL-SAFE DETONATOR
stratagems.legend: Devices are incorporated into some battlesuits either to prevent high-ranking pilots being taken alive for interrogation or to prevent just such fatal explosions.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Any phase, just after a T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model from your army is destroyed.TARGET: That destroyed model’s unit. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even if that unit was just destroyed.EFFECT: Before removing your model from play, if it has the Deadly Demise ability, do not roll for that ability; instead, you can choose whether the result of that roll is a 1 or a 6. If your model does not have the Deadly Demise ability, roll one D6 for each unit within 6" of it: on a 4+, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after a T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model from your army is destroyed.
stratagems.target: That destroyed model’s unit. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even if that unit was just destroyed.
stratagems.effect: Before removing your model from play, if it has the Deadly Demise ability, do not roll for that ability; instead, you can choose whether the result of that roll is a 1 or a 6. If your model does not have the Deadly Demise ability, roll one D6 for each unit within 6" of it: on a 4+, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

stratagems.name: GRAV-INHIBITOR FIELD
stratagems.legend: First used by O’Jir during the battle for Laguna Shard, these battlesuit-mounted emitters batter advancing foes backwards with gravitic pulse waves.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.EFFECT: That enemy unit must immediately take a Battle-shock test and you must roll one D6 for each model in that enemy unit: for each 6, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.
stratagems.effect: That enemy unit must immediately take a Battle-shock test and you must roll one D6 for each model in that enemy unit: for each 6, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

stratagems.name: THE TORCHSTAR GAMBIT
stratagems.legend: Though now disgraced by association with O'Shovah, Sub-Commander Torchstar’s strike-and-fade tactics are still taught - albeit officially under other names - in many Fire caste academies.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that can FLY whose attacks have been resolved this phase.EFFECT: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move. If it does, your unit cannot declare a charge this turn
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that can FLY whose attacks have been resolved this phase.
stratagems.effect: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move. If it does, your unit cannot declare a charge this turn

stratagems.name: THE SHORTENED BLADE
stratagems.legend: Made famous by Commander Farsight and his protege Brightsword, this philosophy encourages pilots to drop into the very teeth of the enemy army and apply their firepower at point-blank range.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Movement phase.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.EFFECT: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models.RESTRICTIONS: A unit targeted with this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models.RESTRICTIONS: A unit targeted with this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

stratagems.name: STIMM INJECTORS
stratagems.legend: On-board hypodermics shunt pain-blockers and chemical stimulants into the pilot's system.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.

abilities.name: Bonded Heroes
abilities.legend: Cadres of T’au Battlesuit pilots fight in a manner inspired by the dynamism and determination of famous and beloved war leaders. Indeed, some of the specialist piloting manoeuvres they employ are named after such icons, in a few rare - and sometimes unofficial - cases even after those who have since fallen far from favour with the Ethereal Council. Either way, these bonded veterans are experts in the deadly art of engaging the enemy in close confines. They plunge into the heart of the enemy army where the fighting is fiercest, and prevail in the name of the Greater Good.
abilities.rawDescription: Each time a T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Strength characteristic of that attack by 1. If that attack targets a unit within 9", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1 as well.
abilities.formattedDescription: Each time a T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Strength characteristic of that attack by 1. If that attack targets a unit within 9", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1 as well.

enhancements.name: Internal Grenade Racks
enhancements.legend: These thigh plates house deployment rails of high-explosive bomblets. As the pilot jets over the foe, the racks can be triggered to dispense a rain of death.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model only. The bearer has the Grenades keyword, and each time the bearer ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit that it moved over during that move. If you do, roll six D6: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model only. The bearer has the Grenades keyword, and each time the bearer ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit that it moved over during that move. If you do, roll six D6: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

enhancements.name: Prototype Weapon System
enhancements.legend: Famed battlesuit pilots are often more than willing to assist Earth caste scientists infield-testing the latest in experimental weapons technology.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model only. Each time the bearer is selected to shoot, select either the [LETHAL HITS] or [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. Until those attacks are resolved, ranged weapons equipped by the bearer have the selected ability.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model only. Each time the bearer is selected to shoot, select either the [LETHAL HITS] or [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. Until those attacks are resolved, ranged weapons equipped by the bearer have the selected ability.

enhancements.name: Puretide Engram Neurochip
enhancements.legend: Commander Puretide was the most gifted T’au war leader of all time. Upon his death, his memories were stored in a neurochip. When implanted into the brain, the bearer can access much of this wisdom.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model only. Each time you target the bearer’s unit with a Stratagem, roll one D6: on a 4+, you gain 1CP.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model only. Each time you target the bearer’s unit with a Stratagem, roll one D6: on a 4+, you gain 1CP.

enhancements.name: Starflare Ignition System
enhancements.legend: The ignition thrusters on selected battlesuits are augmented with optional feed-selectors, allowing the pilot to release a jet of enriched accelerant upon take-off and sending the pilots streaking skywards.
enhancements.rawDescription: T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model only. At the end of your opponent’s turn, if the bearer’s unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, you can remove that unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
enhancements.formattedDescription: T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model only. At the end of your opponent’s turn, if the bearer’s unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, you can remove that unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

stratagems.name: RESPONSIVE VOLLEY
stratagems.legend: Should enemy forces be suddenly revealed during such close-confines combat, Fire caste soldiery are trained to loose immediate, punishing firepower.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Movement phase, just after a FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army opens a Hatchway.TARGET: That FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit.EFFECT: Until the end of the turn, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit wholly on the opposite side of that Hatchway from them, a Critical Hit is scored on an unmodified Hit roll of 5+, instead of only a 6.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after a FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army opens a Hatchway.
stratagems.target: That FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit wholly on the opposite side of that Hatchway from them, a Critical Hit is scored on an unmodified Hit roll of 5+, instead of only a 6.

stratagems.name: PULSE BARRAGE
stratagems.legend: The tight confines of voidship warfare funnel the enemy right into the waiting T'au guns.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your opponent’s Movement or Charge phase.TARGET: One FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army that has not fired Overwatch this phase.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack while firing Overwatch, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ is required to score a hit, instead of an unmodified 6.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement or Charge phase.
stratagems.target: One FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army that has not fired Overwatch this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack while firing Overwatch, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ is required to score a hit, instead of an unmodified 6.

stratagems.name: RETREATING FIRE
stratagems.legend: Collapsing lines of infantry provide a defence in depth through the shipboard confines, allowing the enemy to overextend even as retreating T'au continue to pour fire into them.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Your Shooting phase.TARGET: One FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army.EFFECT: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.
stratagems.target: One FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.

stratagems.name: FIRING LINE
stratagems.legend: Should the foe break through one line of Fire caste defence, the next is ready to push them back from vital sites aboard the contested ship.
stratagems.fullDescription: WHEN: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit destroys a T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army.TARGET: One FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, has not fired Overwatch this turn and is within 9" of that enemy unit.EFFECT: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but when doing so, models in your unit can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target) and, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ is required to score a hit.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit destroys a T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army.
stratagems.target: One FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, has not fired Overwatch this turn and is within 9" of that enemy unit.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but when doing so, models in your unit can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target) and, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ is required to score a hit.

abilities.name: Markerlight Precision
abilities.legend: The inescapable data-beams of markerlights stab out through the venting steam and boiling smoke of the boarding action, questing to paint enemy targets and direct Tan firepower against them.
abilities.rawDescription: Each time a T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army (excluding KROOT units) is selected to shoot, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have their Ballistic Skill characteristic improved by 1 and have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability while targeting an enemy unit that is visible to one or more friendly MARKERLIGHT units that are not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy models.
abilities.formattedDescription: Each time a T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army (excluding KROOT units) is selected to shoot, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have their Ballistic Skill characteristic improved by 1 and have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability while targeting an enemy unit that is visible to one or more friendly MARKERLIGHT units that are not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy models.

enhancements.name: Target Optimisation Microdrones
enhancements.legend: A swarm of tiny experimental drones swarm about this warrior, analysing weaknesses in enemy wargear.
enhancements.rawDescription: CADRE FIREBLADE model only. Once per turn, in your Shooting phase, when a friendly FIRE WARRIOR, PATHFINDER TEAM or CADRE FIREBLADE unit within 6" of the bearer is selected to shoot, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit by 1.
enhancements.formattedDescription: CADRE FIREBLADE model only. Once per turn, in your Shooting phase, when a friendly FIRE WARRIOR, PATHFINDER TEAM or CADRE FIREBLADE unit within 6" of the bearer is selected to shoot, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit by 1.

enhancements.name: Duty’s Echo
enhancements.legend: This tech-inlaid stave glows with the light of the T’au’va, inspiring nearby warriors to greater efforts.
enhancements.rawDescription: ETHEREAL model only. At the end of your Shooting phase, you can select one friendly FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit within 6" of the bearer. If you do, that unit can make a Normal move of up to 3" and then counts as having performed the Set Overwatch Tactical Manoeuvre this turn.
enhancements.formattedDescription: ETHEREAL model only. At the end of your Shooting phase, you can select one friendly FIRE WARRIOR or PATHFINDER TEAM unit within 6" of the bearer. If you do, that unit can make a Normal move of up to 3" and then counts as having performed the Set Overwatch Tactical Manoeuvre this turn.

detachmentAbilities.name: Patient Hunter
detachmentAbilities.legend: The tactical philosophy known as the Kauyon allows for T’au commanders to draw the enemy into a deadly trap, springing it at the perfect moment to deliver a storm of fatal strikes against which none can escape.
detachmentAbilities.rawDescription: From the third battle round onwards, all ranged weapons equipped by T’AU EMPIRE models from your army have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability, or the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead while targeting their unit’s Spotted unit.
detachmentAbilities.formattedDescription: From the third battle round onwards, all ranged weapons equipped by T’AU EMPIRE models from your army have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability, or the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead while targeting their unit’s Spotted unit.

detachmentAbilities.name: Killing Blow
detachmentAbilities.legend: Mont’ka is the most aggressive style of T’au warfare. Its singular focus is the art of identifying a target of opportunity and attacking it swiftly with an overwhelming application of force.
detachmentAbilities.rawDescription: During the first, second and third battle rounds, ranged weapons equipped by T’AU EMPIRE models from your army have the [ASSAULT] ability. During the first, second and third battle rounds, while a unit is a Guided unit, its ranged weapons have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
detachmentAbilities.formattedDescription: During the first, second and third battle rounds, ranged weapons equipped by T’AU EMPIRE models from your army have the [ASSAULT] ability. During the first, second and third battle rounds, while a unit is a Guided unit, its ranged weapons have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

detachmentAbilities.name: Bonded Heroes
detachmentAbilities.legend: Cadres of T’au Battlesuit pilots fight in a manner inspired by the dynamism and determination of famous and beloved war leaders. Indeed, some of the specialist piloting manoeuvres they employ are named after such icons, in a few rare - and sometimes unofficial - cases even after those who have since fallen far from favour with the Ethereal Council. Either way, these bonded veterans are experts in the deadly art of engaging the enemy in close confines. They plunge into the heart of the enemy army where the fighting is fiercest, and prevail in the name of the Greater Good.
detachmentAbilities.rawDescription: Each time a T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Strength characteristic of that attack by 1. If that attack targets a unit within 9", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1 as well.
detachmentAbilities.formattedDescription: Each time a T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Strength characteristic of that attack by 1. If that attack targets a unit within 9", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1 as well.

detachmentAbilities.name: Hunter’s Instincts
